name: swizzle
content:
swizzle noun [C]
(DRINK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a mixed alcoholic drink, usually containing rum (= a strong alcoholic drink made from the juice of the sugar cane plant): The bar is famous for its rum swizzle. A swizzle is a tall, traditionally rum-based cocktail filled with cracked ice.

swizzle noun [C]
(SMALL AMOUNT)
a small amount of something, especially food, that is added in a circular shape to something as a decoration or to add to the taste: Serve the pancakes with a swizzle of honey and a generous squeeze of lime juice. A pot of minestrone is not complete without adding a swizzle of homemade pesto into the finished soup. Compare
drizzle

swizzle noun [C]
(TRICK)
UK informal old-fashioned a situation in which someone tricks another person or tries to get money from them dishonestly or unfairly: One great media swizzle is comparing two risks that are massively different in scale. £10 for a lemonade? What a swizzle! Synonym
